definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
signature dish/a restaurant’s most famous dish

sentences.english: The picture shows a hawker used the police signs resist rain in Delhi.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲德里，一名小販利用警察局招牌擋雨。

sentences.english: This telephone with an inductor call became the company’s trademark.
sentences.chinese: 這部配備感應器的電話機成了該公司的招牌產品。

sentences.english: Mr Bush senior reduced Mr Dukakis to the candidate of card-carrying liberal elitists .
sentences.chinese: 老布什也曾經攻擊杜卡基斯是招牌式的自由派精英。

sentences.english: If the said house Cong lost, put the fruit bar signs gave the king of India.
sentences.chinese: 家聰表示如果輸了，便把果欄的招牌送給印度賭王。

sentences.english: From afar, the bold glare of Chinese characters stands out.
sentences.chinese: 站在遠處看，招牌上炫目的中國字非常醒目。

sentences.english: No man may husband of woman, all wearing a lady's signature.
sentences.chinese: 凡是人盡可夫的女人，都掛着一個淑女的招牌。

sentences.english: The sign was nailed up over the door.
sentences.chinese: 那塊招牌被釘在了門的上方。

sentences.english: His signature dishes include Snapper Baked in Salt Crust and a tableside presentation of Fish Casserole Enriched with Crustaceans.
sentences.chinese: 他的招牌菜包括紅鯛魚配色拉和焙盤魚及貝類配麪包。

sentences.english: Soul Mate also boasts a selection of homemade flavored rums that are certainly one-of-a-kind in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 招牌的自制朗姆酒也絕對是南京獨一無二的。

sentences.english: Wang Baoqiang's signature innocent smile never changes.
sentences.chinese: 王寶強招牌式的淳樸笑容從來沒有變過。

sentences.english: Fascia 300mm(H) standard fascia board with booth number and exhibitor's name in both Chinese and English.
sentences.chinese: 公司招牌參展商中英文名稱及攤位號碼招牌。

sentences.english: Fascia 300mm(H) standard fascia board with booth number and exhibitor's name in both Chinese and English.
sentences.chinese: 公司招牌參展商中英文名稱及攤位號碼招牌。

sentences.english: This is obviously such a popular combination that it is a signature dish of Kentucky Fried Chicken.
sentences.chinese: 這種組合那是相當的出名，幾乎就是KFC的招牌菜。

sentences.english: The sign on the wall seemed to quaver under a film of sliding warm water.
sentences.chinese: 牆上的招牌好象在一層浮動的融融的水流下顫動。

sentences.english: Yagan, who is thirty-four, is also the face.
sentences.chinese: 雅甘今年三十四歲，也是公司的招牌。

sentences.english: While you enjoy the catchy song, don't miss the band's trademark dancing moves.
sentences.chinese: 觀賞這些動聽歌的同時可別疏忽了樂隊的招牌舞姿。

shop, firm, or brand of merchandise with a long-established reputation
proprietor of a shop or restaurant/landlord/shop
